climbs.name: No Country for Old Men
climbs.fa: FA, Bolted and prep by Alan Collins

content.description:
This crumble-fest reminds me of what the aggro gulley must have been like before its popularity. For many, the quality of movement and challenge of the route will justify its crumbles for now. (After some traffic, it will no longer be an issue) 

 Start off a small ledge and immediately start cranking on awkward holds that get better with good body positing. Clipping the 2nd bolts and passing it is the crux, although the uppercut has lots of little cruxes. Clear a small overhang to get to the anchors.
content.protection: bolted with fixed draws all the way to the chains
content.location: Starts on a terrace 5ft below the scooped out cave.

content.description: This line has less than perfect rock but really cool features. Get thru the short juggy  overhanging start and onto the headwall. Crux comes after the 5th bolt.
content.location: Starts right of the cave. Climb thru some big pockets and jugs then trend a little left up the head wall.

content.description:
Just below the babylon wall lies an overhanging wavy wall with a future of unique possibilities.  If those whom may be willing to spend countless hours cleaning this crumbly wall, something may soon resemble the aggro wall in rock quality and quality in movement. 

  Gets morning suns and evening shade. Time varies among seasons.
